Package com.deco2800.game.components.weapons

Class MeleeWeapon

java.lang.Object
com.deco2800.game.components.Component
com.deco2800.game.components.weapons.MeleeWeapon
Direct Known Subclasses:
Axe, Hammer, Longsword, Scepter
public class MeleeWeapon
extends Component
Melee weapon superclass from which all melee weapons will inherit from. Enables entities to attack using a weapon.

      number of light attack frames in animation

      determines whether entity has attacked.

      Time when the entity last attacked, 0 if entity is not attacking.

      Weapon Damage

    • targetLayer

      protected final short targetLayer
      The physics layer the weapon can damage

    • knockback

      protected final float knockback
      Physical Knockback of weapon

    • combatStats

      protected CombatStatsComponent combatStats
      Base stats of owner entity

    • weaponSize

      protected Vector2 weaponSize
      Weapon attack width and range in terms of x and y, relative to entity size

    • weaponHitbox

      protected WeaponHitboxComponent weaponHitbox
      Hit box used by this melee weapon. NOTE: Multiple melee weapons equipped on the same entity can re-use the same weapon hit box instance, provided they aren't setting/destroying it simultaneously.

  • Constructor Details

    • MeleeWeapon

      public MeleeWeapon​(short targetLayer, int attackPower, float knockback, Vector2 weaponSize)

  • Method Details

    • create

      public void create()
      Description copied from class: Component
      Called when the entity is created and registered. Initial logic such as calls to GetComponent should be made here, not in the constructor which is called before an entity is finished.
      Overrides:
      create in class Component

    • update

      public void update()
      Update uses timer to synchronise attack with animation. Assumes that animation has only 3 frames.
      Overrides:
      update in class Component

    • attack

      public void attack​(int attackDirection)
      Weapon attack, called by owner entity. Sets flags used in update(), to sync the attack with the animation. Actual functionality for attacking is implemented inside triggerAttackStage()
      Parameters:
      attackDirection - direction of attack (see above for defined constants).

    • rangedAttack

      public void rangedAttack​(int attackDirection)
      The weapon's ranged attack. This is to be implemented in weapon sub-classes.

    • aoeAttack

      public void aoeAttack()
      The weapon's AEO (area of effect) attack.

    • triggerAttackStage

      protected void triggerAttackStage​(long timeSinceAttack)
      Used by update() to sync weapon hit box with animation.
      Parameters:
      timeSinceAttack - the time elapsed since the entity last attacked 0 - if the entity is not attacking.

    • setAttackFrameDuration

      public void setAttackFrameDuration​(long frameDuration)
      Sets frame duration, which determines how long an attack lasts.
      Parameters:
      frameDuration - how long each attack animation frame takes.

    • setAttackFrames

      public void setAttackFrames​(long frameDuration, int numOfFrames, int attackIndex)
      Sets all frame information, which determines when an attack lands, and how long the attack lasts.
      Parameters:
      frameDuration - how long each attack animation frame takes in milliseconds
      numOfFrames - number of frames in the attack animation
      attackIndex - the index of the frame where the attack lands. Attack lasts for 1 frame duration.

    • getTotalAttackTime

      public long getTotalAttackTime()
      Returns the total time the attack will take.
      Returns:
      total time of attack

    • onCollisionStart

      protected boolean onCollisionStart​(Fixture me, Fixture other)
      Collision method used by weapon to detect collisions with enemy entities, defined by the target layer.
      Parameters:
      me - - the fixture used to represent this weapon
      other - - the fixture that our weapon is colliding with.
      Returns:
      true - if weapon collided with enemy target false - otherwise.
      See Also:
      TouchAttackComponent
